examples.title: sizeInfo

description: The sizeInfo visual variable defines how size is applied to features based on the values of a numeric field attribute. The minimum and maximum values of the data should be indicated along with their respective size values. You must specify either `minSize` and `maxSize`, or `stops`, or `valueUnit` to construct the size ramp. All features with values falling in between the specified min and max data values (or stops) will be scaled proportionally between the provided min and max sizes.
title: SizeInfo Visual Variable

$eref.description: Options available for the legend for visual variables.
$eref.title: Visual Variable Legend Options

___showLegend.description: Indicates whether to show the color/size/opacity ramp in the legend.

___maxSize.description: Specifies the maximum size to be applied to the symbol. This is required if valueUnit is set to `unknown`.

___type.description: Specifies the type of visual variable.

___minSize.description: Specifies the minimum size to be applied to the symbol. This is required if valueUnit is set to `unknown`.

___valueExpressionTitle.description: The title identifying and describing the associated [Arcade](https://developers.arcgis.com/arcade/) expression as defined in the `valueExpression` property.

___normalizationField.description: Attribute field used to normalize the data.

___field.description: Attribute field used for size rendering if no valueExpression is provided.

___valueRepresentation.description: Specifies how to apply the data value when mapping real-world sizes. See table below for supported values.

___useSymbolValue.description: When setting a size visual variable on a renderer using an ObjectSymbol3DLayer, this property indicates whether to apply the value defined by the height, width, or depth properties to the corresponding axis of this visual variable instead of proportionally scaling this axis' value after other axes.

___target.description: Only used when sizeInfo is used for polygon outlines.

___stops.description: An array of objects that defines the thematic size ramp in a sequence of data or expression stops. At least two stops are required. The stops must be listed in ascending order based on the value of the `value` property in each stop. This property is required if `minDataValue`, `maxDataValue`, `minSize`, and `maxSize` are not defined.

$eref.description: A `sizeStop` object describes the size of the symbol at various values of the expression.
$eref.title: sizeStop

___value.description: The value to be mapped to a size.

___size.description: Specifies the marker size to use for the specified value.

___axis.description: Defines the axis the size visual variable should be applied to when rendering features with an ObjectSymbol3DLayer.

___valueUnit.description: A string value indicating the unit of measurement. Defaults to `meters` if not set.
